result.execSummary:
The defendant William J. Lekander was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant William J. Lekander in court with attorney Brent Wayne Varner.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant pled no contest.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 5 days in jail, with Huber work release.  $543.00 costs.  Submit DNA sample.  60 days to pay fine or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts.  Jail start on 4/14/17 at 7:00 pm.  May transfer to Dane County Jail.  Jail credit to be determined.  Bond on hand to be applied.

Defendant William J. Lekander by video, in custody with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Warrant quashed.  Bond argument was heard.  Court set $150.00 cash bond.  Return date scheduled for February 27, 2017 at 02:45 pm.
